attack-object.name: User Execution
attack-object.score-comment: This control only provides detection for one of this technique's sub-techniques while not providing any detection capability for its other sub-technique, and therefore its coverage score is Partial, resulting in a Partial score.

attack-object.name: Masquerading
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides detection for some of this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples and therefore its coverage score is Partial, resulting in a Partial score. Its detection occurs once every twelve hours, so its temporal score is also Partial.

attack-object.name: Subvert Trust Controls
attack-object.score-comment: This control only provides detection for one of this technique's sub-techniques while not providing any detection capability for the remaining sub-techniques, and therefore its coverage score is Minimal, resulting in a Minimal score.

attack-object.name: Compromise Client Software Binary
attack-object.score-comment: Once this control is activated, it generates alerts for any executable that is run and is not included in an allow list. While name and publisher-based allow lists may fail to detect malicious modifications to executable client binaries, hash-based rules will still detect untrusted executables. Events are calculated once every twelve hours, so its temporal score is Partial.
